relations.target: terrain=08692301-n (a piece of ground having specific characteristics or military potential; \""they decided to attack across the rocky terrain\""

mountain=09382700-n (a land mass that projects well above its surroundings; higher than a hill);13796604-n ((often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent; \""a batch of letters\""; \""a deal of trouble\""; \""a lot of money\""; \""he made a mint on the stock market\""; \""see the rest of the winners in our huge passel of photos\""; \""it must have cost plenty\""; \""a slew of journalists\""; \""a wad of money\""

hill=03797581-n (structure consisting of an artificial heap or bank usually of earth or stones; \""they built small mounds to hide behind\"");03797867-n ((baseball) the slight elevation on which the pitcher stands);09325914-n (a local and well-defined elevation of the land; \""they loved to roam the hills of West Virginia\"");01664534-v (form into a hill

formation=00237945-n (the act of forming or establishing something; \""the constitution of a PTA group last year\""; \""it was the establishment of his reputation\""; \""he still remembers the organization of the club\"");00927021-n (the act of fabricating something in a particular shape);00929331-n (creation by mental activity; \""the formation of sentences\""; \""the formation of memories\"");03389963-n (a particular spatial arrangement);08443418-n (an arrangement of people or things acting as a unit; \""a defensive formation\""; \""a formation of planes\"");09310874-n ((geology) the geological features of the earth);13504691-n (natural process that causes something to form; \""the formation of gas in the intestine\""; \""the formation of crystals\""; \""the formation of pseudopods\""

rock=00348834-n (pitching dangerously to one side);07078755-n (a genre of popular music originating in the 1950s; a blend of black rhythm-and-blues with white country-and-western; \""rock is a generic term for the range of styles that evolved out of rock'n'roll.\"");07624692-n (hard bright-colored stick candy (typically flavored with peppermint));09438954-n (a lump or mass of hard consolidated mineral matter; \""he threw a rock at me\"");10554923-n ((figurative) someone who is strong and stable and dependable; \""he was her rock during the crisis\""; \""Thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church\""--Gospel According to Matthew);14720954-n (material consisting of the aggregate of minerals like those making up the Earth's crust; \""that mountain is solid rock\""; \""stone is abundant in New England and there are many quarries\"");01879288-v (move back and forth or sideways; \""the ship was rocking\""; \""the tall building swayed\""; \""She rocked back and forth on her feet\"");01880021-v (cause to move back and forth; \""rock the cradle\""; \""rock the baby\""; \""the wind swayed the trees gently\""

senses.definition: A rock formation that encircles a hill or mountain, separating other kinds of terrain that are above and below it
